summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the case USA v. Ghislaine Maxwell, scheduling the trial to begin on November 29, 2021, with jury selection the week of November 15, 2021. The order grants the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act and sets deadlines for motions in limine and pretrial disclosures.

events.title: Trial Commencement Scheduled
events.description: The court orders that opening statements for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell will be made to the jury on this date, pending approval from the Clerk's Office.

events.title: Jury Selection Scheduled
events.description: The court requests that jury selection for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell occur during this week.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: Judge J. Nathan signs an order scheduling the trial, granting a motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act, and setting pretrial deadlines.

events.title: Deadline for Joint Letter
events.description: The parties are ordered to meet, confer, and submit a joint letter by this date regarding adjustments to the pretrial disclosure schedule.

locations: U.S. District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin with opening statements on November 29, 2021, and jury selection the week of November 15, 2021.
The court granted the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act from May 11, 2021, to November 29, 2021, to allow for case preparation.
The order was issued by Judge J. Nathan (Alison J. Nathan) in response to proposals from both the prosecution and defense.
The document lists numerous attorneys of record for Ghislaine Maxwell, including David Boles, II, Laura A. Menninger, and Bobbi C Sternheim.
The court ordered the parties to meet and confer and submit a joint letter by May 14, 2021, to propose adjustments to the pretrial disclosure schedule.
